meanings.definition: To give official authorization or approval to
meanings.sent1: The school accredits the new program for meeting all the educational standards.
meanings.sent2: The government accredits universities to ensure they provide quality education.
meanings.sent3: The cat accredits the mouse with the disappearance of the cheese.
meanings.sent4: Her success accredits her hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The badge accredits him as a certified lifeguard.

meanings.definition: To provide with credentials or official recognition
meanings.sent1: The organization accredits professionals who have completed the required training.
meanings.sent2: The committee accredits the company for its commitment to environmental sustainability.
meanings.sent3: The superhero accredits his powers to a radioactive spider bite.
meanings.sent4: His impressive resume accredits him as a qualified candidate for the job.
meanings.sent5: The certificate accredits her as a skilled pastry chef.

meanings.definition: To attribute to a source or origin
meanings.sent1: The ancient manuscript accredits the poem to an unknown poet.
meanings.sent2: Historians accredit the invention of the printing press to Johannes Gutenberg.
meanings.sent3: The detective humorously accredits the missing cookies to a cookie monster.
meanings.sent4: The artist accredits her inspiration to the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: The legend accredits the creation of the universe to a cosmic explosion.
